pull.title: [DO NOT MERGE] cmake: Migrate CI scripts to CMake-based build system -- WIP
pull.body: This PR goal is to facilitate testing CI scripts migration to the CMake.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage
For detailed information about the code coverage, see the [test coverage report](https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/29790).
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
A summary of reviews will appear here.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#29761](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29761) (build: Consider `SOURCE_DATE_EPOCH` in Guix environment only by hebasto)
* [#29645](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29645) (doc: update release-process.md by glozow)
* [#29641](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29641) (scripted-diff: Use LogInfo/LogDebug over LogPrintf/LogPrint by maflcko)
* [#26950](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26950) (cleanse: switch to SecureZeroMemory for Windows cross-compile, check for usage by fanquake)
* [#25972](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25972) (build: no-longer disable WARN_CXXFLAGS when CXXFLAGS is set by fanquake)
* [#25573](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25573) ([POC] guix: produce a fully `-static-pie` bitcoind by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

<!--85328a0da195eb286784d51f73fa0af9-->

ðŸš§ At least one of the CI tasks failed. Make sure to run all tests locally, according to the
documentation.

Possibly this is due to a silent merge conflict (the changes in this pull request being
incompatible with the current code in the target branch). If so, make sure to rebase on the latest
commit of the target branch.

Leave a comment here, if you need help tracking down a confusing failure.

<sub>Debug: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/runs/23353954951</sub>

issue.title: build: Consider `SOURCE_DATE_EPOCH` in Guix environment only
issue.body:
The [`SOURCE_DATE_EPOCH`](https://reproducible-builds.org/docs/source-date-epoch/) environment variable is supposed to be used to achieve build reproducibility.

However, using it outside Guix scripts for local builds on macOS is not meaningful.

This PR makes usage of `SOURCE_DATE_EPOCH` for macOS consistent with other platforms and simplifies [upcoming](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/pull/129) CMake-based build system scripts.

issue.title: ci: remove --with-asm=no (secp256k1) from MSAN jobs
issue.body:
Bumps LLVM to `18.1.3`:
* Includes https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pull/86201, which is useful as it removes the need to (possibly) apply a work around when running the CI locally.

Drops `--with-asm=no` (only being passed to secp256k1) from the MSAN CI. New MSAN annotations were pulled in as part of #29803.

issue.title: doc: update release-process.md
issue.body: While doing various release process things for the first time, I noticed some of our docs are outdated and/or confusing.

issue.title: scripted-diff: Use LogInfo/LogDebug over LogPrintf/LogPrint
issue.body:
`LogPrintf/LogPrint` are problematic, because:

* Their name is non-descriptive of what the function does (info logging or debug logging).
* They are deprecated aliases, where code is using either the deprecated or non-deprecated alias, which is inconsistent and confusing.

Fix all issues by replacing the usage.

While the diff is large and may cause merge conflicts or backport conflicts, I don't see the deprecated aliases being kept forever, so this will have to be done at some point. All conflicts should be trivial to solve, in any case.

issue.title: Remove the legacy wallet and BDB dependency
issue.body:
The final step of #20160.

A bare minimum of legacy wallet code is kept in order to perform wallet migration. Migration of legacy wallets uses the independent BDB parser and a minimal `LegacyDataSPKM` that allows the legacy data to be loaded so that the migration can be completed.

All tests which tested legacy wallet behavior have been removed. The `--descriptors` and `--legacy-wallet` options are removed from the functional tests.

BDB has been removed as a dependency and documentation have been updated to reflect that.

Depends on #26596

issue.title: cleanse: switch to SecureZeroMemory for Windows cross-compile, check for usage
issue.body:
This PR switches our Windows release builds to use the [`SecureZeroMemory()`](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/windows/desktop/legacy/aa366877(v=vs.85)) provided by mingw-w64, and attempts to add a check that it hasn't been optimised out, as claimed will not happen (these kinds of checks may also become more valuable as we move towards using LTO).

With this change, `memory_cleanse` looks something like:
```asm
0000000140521fc0 <memory_cleanse(void*, unsigned long long)>:
140521fc0: f3 0f 1e fa                 	endbr64
140521fc4: 57                          	pushq	%rdi
140521fc5: 48 83 ec 30                 	subq	$48, %rsp
140521fc9: 4c 8b 05 e0 83 7a 00        	movq	8029152(%rip), %r8      # 0x140cca3b0 <.refptr.__stack_chk_guard>
140521fd0: 49 8b 00                    	movq	(%r8), %rax
140521fd3: 48 89 44 24 28              	movq	%rax, 40(%rsp)
140521fd8: 31 c0                       	xorl	%eax, %eax
140521fda: 48 89 cf                    	movq	%rcx, %rdi
140521fdd: 48 89 d1                    	movq	%rdx, %rcx
140521fe0: f3 aa                       	rep		stosb	%al, %es:(%rdi)
140521fe2: 48 8b 44 24 28              	movq	40(%rsp), %rax
140521fe7: 49 2b 00                    	subq	(%r8), %rax
140521fea: 75 06                       	jne	0x140521ff2 <memory_cleanse(void*, unsigned long long)+0x32>
140521fec: 48 83 c4 30                 	addq	$48, %rsp
140521ff0: 5f                          	popq	%rdi
140521ff1: c3                          	retq
140521ff2: e8 99 c6 34 00              	callq	0x14086e690 <__stack_chk_fail>
140521ff7: 90                          	nop
140521ff8: 90                          	nop
``` 

So we look for the (Microsoft specific) [`__stosb`](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/cpp/intrinsics/stosb?view=msvc-170) instruction that is used by [mingw-w64](https://github.com/mirror/mingw-w64/blob/master/mingw-w64-crt/intrincs/RtlSecureZeroMemory.c):
```c
PVOID WINAPI RtlSecureZeroMemory(PVOID ptr,SIZE_T cnt)
{
  volatile char *vptr = (volatile char *)ptr;
#ifdef __x86_64
  __stosb ((PBYTE)((DWORD64)vptr),0,cnt);
#else
  while (cnt != 0)
    {
      *vptr++ = 0;
      cnt--;
    }
#endif /* __x86_64 */
  return ptr;
```

Draft for now. Need to think about how best to integrate checks like this, into/around our `test-security-checks`. Working on a similar change for the rest of our builds that use std::memset + a compiler barrier.

Guix Build:
```bash
b5c8937de75f74b233fb9e9d285fb65cfad646ff95abe1386e4c30f18dee4588  guix-build-7fe215390ec9/output/dist-archive/bitcoin-7fe215390ec9.tar.gz
0b996a10a4f2973d919b30ee3307a2dbfb730be0d088466ae3da1c75735687e0  guix-build-7fe215390ec9/output/x86_64-w64-mingw32/SHA256SUMS.part
bf43d2c888475d8165c8420124c3450b6987ff5bdf57c966d0f31983666950e7  guix-build-7fe215390ec9/output/x86_64-w64-mingw32/bitcoin-7fe215390ec9-win64-debug.zip
d795a33c1ae32b5ade9dbe05504255e0af18bb444cfc5584c0c02d19821b89b6  guix-build-7fe215390ec9/output/x86_64-w64-mingw32/bitcoin-7fe215390ec9-win64-setup-unsigned.exe
ab4f075dc4cebde11b459fe4d0fddf372eb02abcd3092998e2d377aa52ce02f1  guix-build-7fe215390ec9/output/x86_64-w64-mingw32/bitcoin-7fe215390ec9-win64-unsigned.tar.gz
a0d42fea3b9c000280bb3d5c694b6889ca3763ffa63946ad92805abb838ddf5b  guix-build-7fe215390ec9/output/x86_64-w64-mingw32/bitcoin-7fe215390ec9-win64.zip
```

issue.title: build: no-longer disable WARN_CXXFLAGS when CXXFLAGS is set
issue.body:
Now that `CXXFLAGS` are [back in user control](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24391), I don't think there's a
reason to no-longer use our warning flags when `CXXFLAGS` has been
overriden (this includes, by default, when building from depends).

Anyone can suppress warnings from third-party code by
passing the relevant `-Wno-` options in `CXXFLAGS`.

Based on #29165.
Closes: #18092.

issue.title: [POC] guix: produce a fully `-static-pie` bitcoind
issue.body:
Use Guix to produce a fully `-static-pie` `x86_64-linux-gnu` bitcoind using GCC 13.2.0 and glibc 2.39. The binary is ~15mb stripped, includes wallet/upnp/natpmp/zmq etc.

```bash
# file bitcoind
	ELF 64-bit LSB pie executable, x86-64, version 1 (GNU/Linux), static-pie linked, for GNU/Linux 3.2.0, stripped

# ldd bitcoind
	statically linked
```

[`-static-pie`](https://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/gcc/Link-Options.html)
> Produce a static position independent executable on targets that support it.
A static position independent executable is similar to a static executable,
but can be loaded at any address without a dynamic linker.

Using glibc for static builds, would be less of a leap compared to switching to musl libc (POC in #23203).

issue.title: build: LLD based macOS toolchain
issue.body:
This switches us to using a [LLD](https://lld.llvm.org/) based toolchain for macOS builds.

### Benefits
* Less complicated macOS toolchain.
* Drop `FORCE_USE_SYSTEM_CLANG` in favour of always using the system Clang.
* No longer beholden to Apple releasing it's [source](https://opensource.apple.com/source/) for [cctools](https://opensource.apple.com/source/cctools/), [ld64](https://opensource.apple.com/source/ld64/) & [libtapi](https://opensource.apple.com/source/tapi/).
* No more reliance on third parties to modify those sources for us. i.e [apple-libtapi](https://github.com/tpoechtrager/apple-libtapi), [cctools-port](https://github.com/tpoechtrager/cctools-port) (cctools + ld64).

issue.title: cmake: Add `MULTIPROCESS` option
issue.body:
Also a new "Linux 64-bit, multiprocess" CI task has been added.

Also see: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29665.

issue.title: ci: Drop duplicated compiler flags
issue.body:
On the master branch @ 0d509bab45d292caeaf34600e57b5928757c6005, it is easy to check the _"Options used to compile and link"_ section in the `configure` script output and observe duplicated compiler flags.

This PR cleans such cases up.

issue.title: build: Assume HAVE_CONFIG_H, Add IWYU pragma keep to bitcoin-config.h includes
issue.body:
The `bitcoin-config.h` includes have issues:

* The header is incompatible with iwyu, so the `IWYU pragma: keep` is needed. Compare the previous discussion in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29408#issuecomment-1948959711
* Guarding the includes by `HAVE_CONFIG_H` is verbose and brittle. Compare the previous discussion in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29404#discussion_r1483189853 . Now that most build config dependencies have been removed from low level headers, the benefits are questionable, and the guard can be removed.

issue.title: ci: Migrate CI scripts to CMake
issue.body:
For the same changes in the master branch with CI logs, please see https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29790.

Still no Android-related changes.
